Not sure if this is the correct location to ask this question, and it's a very basic one that has probably been asked a thousand times. ButÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

I can't seem to find the location of the config files, I'm thinking about changing some values in them. Specifically, some parts attributes. Can someone let me know where I might find them? I use a Mac, OSX 10.8.5. Thanks in advance!

Edit: Forgot to mention I use the Steam default location. I've done searches in finder and can't seem to locate the obvious location for any game data files.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T21:02:08Z" title="05/07/2015 09:02  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by justidutch**
  
Forgot to mention I use Steam
Find the installation folder (where the KSP.exe is located) then go into GameData, then Squad, then it should be obvious from there.
Errr, I don't think .exe files run on Mac natively. I should have mentioned I use the Steam default location.

Okay, the KSP program/app/whatever-you-call-it. I mean the same thing.

It'll be where steam stores it then. Find where that is, then follow the folders I mentioned.

The default Steam install location should be "Library/Application Support/Steam/SteamApps/common/Kerbal Space Program/" under your home directory. Parts can be found at GameData/Squad/Parts/ under that.

Thanks for the replies so far. But wow. Something is very strange, I have no "Library/Application Support/Steam" directory! 

I do a search for "Steam" and all I get is the app file.

I do a search for "KSP" or "Kerbal", all I get is the application file if the Applications directory.

Searching for "Squad" or "parts" returns no results.

I will have to look into this further when I return home from work.
You should be able to open the game folder with the Steam client, right click on KSP and click Properties, there's a tab for local files.
